test_description: Verify Technician mobile app successfully queues job completion data while offline and synchronizes with backend upon network restoration without data loss or corruption.
business_risk: Critical - Data loss leads to billing disputes and incomplete service history (US-005)
preconditions: Technician logged in; 'Work In Progress' job exists; Device in Airplane Mode; Local WatermelonDB initialized
test_steps: 1. Put device in offline mode; 2. Open assigned job; 3. Enter completion notes and capture signature; 4. Tap 'Mark as Resolved'; 5. Verify local 'pending_sync' state; 6. Restore network connection; 7. Verify sync trigger
expected_result: Job updates locally immediately; Sync queue processes upon reconnection; Backend status updates to 'Resolved'; Signature blob uploads to Azure Storage
test_data_needs: Test technician account; Assigned Service Request; Sample signature blob
tools_required: Detox (React Native); Charles Proxy (Network Throttling); Mock Service Worker
dependencies: WatermelonDB Schema; Sync Endpoint; Azure Blob Storage
environment_requirements: Mobile Emulator with Network Control; Staging Backend
success_criteria: Zero data loss; Sync completes within 30s of reconnection; Conflict resolution strategy (Last-Write-Wins) applied correctly
failure_impact: Technician cannot complete jobs in remote areas; Operational paralysis
data_setup_complexity: High - Requires specific local DB state
cleanup_requirements: Reset device local storage; Reset backend job status
security_considerations: Local data encryption (SQLCipher); Secure token refresh during sync
accessibility_requirements: Offline status indicator visible to screen readers

test_description: Validate performance of PostGIS 'ST_Contains' query when routing a service request to the correct Service Center polygon under high concurrency.
business_risk: High - Slow routing degrades user experience; Incorrect routing leads to SLA breaches (US-001)
preconditions: PostGIS database seeded with 500+ complex service area polygons; Redis cache warm
test_steps: 1. Generate 1000 concurrent service requests with random lat/long coordinates; 2. Hit routing endpoint; 3. Measure latency and accuracy
expected_result: API returns correct Service Center ID for each coordinate; P95 latency stays under 200ms
test_data_needs: GeoJSON polygons for Service Centers; Random coordinate generator
environment_requirements: Performance Environment with Production-like Data Volume
success_criteria: P95 Latency < 200ms; 0% Error Rate; Correct Polygon matching
failure_impact: Service delays; System timeout during peak loads
regression_frequency: Every backend release modifying routing logic
